channel.title: casual inference on YoungStatS
channel.description: Recent content in casual inference on YoungStatS

item.title: Machine learning for causal inference that works
item.description: I’ve kindly been invited to share a few words about a recent paper my colleagues and I published in Bayesian Analysis: “Bayesian Regression Tree Models for Causal Inference: Regularization, Confounding, and Heterogeneous Effects”. In that paper, we motivate and describe a method that we call Bayesian causal forests (BCF), which is now implemented in an R package called bcf. The goal of this post is to work through a simple toy example to illustrate the strengths of BCF.
